Subjective: Generalized fatigue for ~2 months. Wakes up tired despite sleeping a lot; sleep quality possibly superficial. Onset insidious, unsure if gradual or sudden. Associated with increased muscle pain and back pain; also notes morning stiffness. Work is manageable but difficult; no sick days taken. Rests on weekends. Able to maintain physical activity (climbing 2-3x/week, cycling) without significant loss of strength, shortness of breath, or acid reflux. No preceding illness or major life stressor. No snoring, palpitations, chest pain, appetite change, or weight change (stable at 72 kg). Bowels normal (3-4x/day, smooth). Urination normal. No specific joint pain in hands or feet. Hay fever symptoms controlled with medication. Social: Active lifestyle. No smoking/alcohol mentioned. Request: Unsure of cause; concerned about muscle pain and potential for rheumatism based on online search.
Objective: Vitals: BP 110/60, HR 50-60 bpm. Lungs: Clear to auscultation. Heart: Normal heart sounds. Abdomen: Supple, non-tender on deep palpation, lively peristalsis. MSK: Tenderness on palpation of lower back, paraspinal. No pain on pelvic compression. Neck and shoulders have full, painless range of motion.
Assessment: Fatigue, 2-month duration. Differential diagnosis includes anemia, thyroid disorder, and inflammatory conditions. Significant cardiopulmonary disease less likely given history and exam.
Plan: Order blood tests: Check for anemia, thyroid function, and inflammatory markers.
Patient to schedule blood draw via online form.
Follow-up: Patient to call clinic one day after blood test to schedule a phone appointment for results.
